pattern workflow milo is worked from the top down inspiration for the construction is from the cokoknits workshop book with german short row instead of increases for the back shoulder shaping 2 knitting of course milo first the top part of the back yoke is worked back and forth with german short row then the shoulders are worked from stitches that are picked up and knitted along the cast on edge stitches are then picked up and knitted along the sides of the shoulders then increases are made to shape the sleeves front neckline and body the yoke is worked back and forth until the underarms where the sleeves will be placed on hold while underarm stitches and front henley stitches are cast on for joining the body in the round the body is worked in the round and ended with a 1x1 rib the sleeves are placed back on needles and underarm stitches
